gauzy: gauzy material appears to be a thin and delicate fabric often made of silk or cotton and commonly used in clothing and upholstery.
a gauzy surface is often shrouded in a delicate haze of morning fog or mist.
meshed: a meshed surface is a pattern of small holes or gaps in a material such as fabric or concrete.
a meshed surface appears to have many intertwined fibers or threads woven together creating a complex texture and pattern that can vary greatly depending on the type of material used.
cracked: cracked material typically shows visible fissures or breaks.
a cracked texture is often visible as small cracks or fissures in the material usually caused by drying out or moisture loss.
stratified: a stratified surface is composed of layers with varying textures and colors depending on the material that forms it, often seen in nature or created in art and design.
stratified materials are composed of layers of varying textures and colors depending on the material's composition.
scaly: a scaly surface is typically formed by small projections called scales that cover the skin of reptiles such as turtles and crocodiles which provide protection and aid in movement.
scaly material often appears as thick, rough, and wavy patterns usually found in reptiles such as snakes and lizards and also in some types of fish and insects.
swirly: a swirly surface is typically characterized by concentric layers of colors or patterns that form when a liquid is subjected to centrifugal force.
a swirly surface appears to be an irregularly shaped mass of colored liquid that has a chaotic pattern of movement and flow.

flecked: a flecked texture is characterized by tiny specks of color on a smooth surface.
a flecked texture is one with specks scattered across its surface like tiny pinpricks of color.
fibrous: a fibrous texture is often seen in plant cells and bone structures.
fibrous material has a texture that resembles string or twine and often forms large aggregates or networks.
polka-dotted: a polka dot texture is created by small bumps on a surface that repeat every two inches in a grid pattern.
a polka dot texture is characterized by small dots of color scattered randomly across a surface in a repeating pattern often with the dots of the same color connected to each other.
chequered: chequered material has a distinctive appearance with squares of different colors.
a chequered texture is typically characterized by alternating strips of different colors on a background.

crystalline: crystalline material appears as transparent or translucent object with clear and sharp edges.

porous: a porous surface has tiny holes or openings that allow air or water to pass through gently.
a porous texture appears as uneven or rough surface.
banded: a banded surface appears as a series of distinct bands of color that vary in hue from one end of the spectrum to the other across the surface.

lacelike: a lacelike surface is formed when fibers are woven together and dried to create a thick, textured layer that resembles a woven fabric.
a lacelike surface is characterized by a fine network of threads that are woven together to form a shiny, lustrous texture that is often smooth to the touch.
sprinkled: a sprinkled texture is often described as speckled or mottled with tiny, isolated grains or particles that resemble scattered bits of dust or sand.
a sprinkled surface appears as scattered tiny droplets of water or other liquids on the surrounding material.
bubbly: bubbly material typically has a clear liquid with small, floating particles suspended in it.
bubbly material is liquid filled with air or carbon dioxide bubbles.
lined: linen material consists of cotton or linen fabric that is woven in a plain weave pattern.
lined paper is a type of paper with perforations that allow the user to tear the page straight down the middle of it.
veined: a veined surface typically has a pattern of color changes, often from light to dark, appearing on the surface of various materials such as wood, stone, and fabrics.
bumpy: a bumpy surface typically appears as a collection of small irregularities and protrusions that cover its entire area without any uniform pattern or surface texture period.
bumpy material is often irregular and uneven in texture and shape.
paisley: a paisley texture is a intricate pattern of curved lines and colors that resembles a paisley plant.
paisley is a type of printed fabric often featuring intricate floral patterns that are typically circular in shape.

spiralled: a spiraled surface is characterized by a curved shape with a helical pattern that tapers inward as it progresses, often appearing rounded or bowl-like at the beginning and tapering to a point at the end.

dotted: dotted lines are small short wavy horizontal lines that appear between paragraphs or when typing on computers and are often used to separate text.

crosshatched: crosshatched material resembles a pattern of small, intersecting lines and dots, typically created using a tool or technique to achieve a specific visual effect on wood or other materials.

wrinkled: a wrinkled surface is often difficult to hold the object in place because of the numerous creases it develops over time.

smeared: a smeared texture appears as if the paint is all over the wall and has a soft blended appearance with some areas of heavier impasto work.
smeared material appears as a thin and blurry discoloration on surfaces when it is applied in excess.
striped: striped material is typically woven with a specific pattern of alternating colors on each thread that creates a distinctive texture and visual interest.
striped material is typically a pattern of small, evenly spaced bands of color on a background fabric usually cotton or synthetic.
braided: a braided surface is a woven pattern created by interlacing strands of material such as yarn or thread, creating a textured and visually appealing effect.
a braided surface has an intricate pattern of interconnected strands woven together.
freckled: a freckled texture has small, raised bumps of different colors often scattered randomly throughout a surface.

grid: a grid surface is a flat and uniform pattern of lines and squares on a floor or other surface.
